text: Kʼukʼ Bahlam I,The ruler's name, when transcribed is KʼUKʼ[BAHLAM], translated "Quetzal Jaguar". also known as Kuk and Bahlum Kʼukʼ, (March 30, 397 - 435?), was a founder and ajaw of the ruling dynasty at the Maya city of Palenque. He founded the dynasty on March 10, 431.These are the dates indicated on the Maya inscriptions in Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, Born: 8.18.0.13.6 5 Kimi 14 Kʼayab and Acceded: 8.19.15.3.4 1 Kʼan 2 Kʼayab. == Depiction == One stone censer stand portrays one of the Palenque kings named Kʼukʼ Bahlam, as the subject can be identified by a quetzal (kʼuk') headdress and jaguar (bahlam) ears. == Notes == == Sources == Category:397 births Category:Rulers of Palenque Category:5th-century monarchs in North America Category:Year of death unknown Category:5th century in the Maya civilization
title: Kʼukʼ Bahlam I
